str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To sing.
Fresh, new, unused, novel. Of uncertain affinity; new
An ode, song, hymn. From aido; a chant or 'ode'.
Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A papyrus roll. A diminutive of biblos; a roll.
And, even, also, namely.
To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Probably strengthened from phrasso; a signet; by implication, the stamp impressed, literally or figuratively.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To slay, kill by violence, slaughter, wound mortally. A primary verb; to butcher or to slaughter, or, to maim.
And, even, also, namely.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A tribe or race of people. From phuo; an offshoot, i.e. Race or clan.
And, even, also, namely.
The tongue; by implication, a language.
And, even, also, namely.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
And, even, also, namely.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
